intro: Dovyalis keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan sour plum, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and edible, sour fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The fruit is often used in local cuisines and has potential medicinal uses due to its high vitamin C content.
